Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.scenecontrollers

Class GameBoardSceneController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observers.ViewObservable
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.scenecontrollers.GameBoardSceneController
All Implemented Interfaces:
GenericSceneController
public class GameBoardSceneController extends ViewObservable implements GenericSceneController
This scene controller controls the Game Board scene, updating all of its contents everytime a player does something.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    activateAssistantCardChoice()
    Allows the player to click one of the cards of their Assistant Cards deck.
    void
    activateCharacterCards()
    Allows the player to click one of the available Character Cards.
    void
    activateCloudChoice()
    Allows the player to click one of the present clouds.
    void
    activateIslands()
    Allows the player to click one of the islands currently present on the Game Board.
    void
    activateMoveStudent()
    Allows the player to click a student into the hall of their school.
    void
    activatePlayerDiningRoom()
    Allows the player to click the dining room of their school.

    Returns the Game whose data are displayed on the scene.

    Returns the nickname of the user.

    onClickAssistantCard(javafx.event.Event e)
    Tries to play an Assistant Card when clicked by the player.

    Tries to play a Character Card when clicked.
    void
    onClickCloud(javafx.event.Event e)
    Picks the students from a cloud when clicked (if possible).
    void
    onClickIsland(javafx.event.Event e)
    According to what happened before, moves the selected student onto the clicked island or selects the clicked island to do the effect of a IntCard / StringIntCard there.
    void
    onClickPlayerDiningRoom(javafx.event.Event e)
    Moves a student previously selected to the proper table when the dining hall is clicked (it doesn't matter if a player clicks on the wrong table: since it's the whole dining room that is clickable and not the single tables, the controller will do the work for the player and place the student correctly).
    void
    onClickPlayerHall(javafx.event.Event e)
    Allows the movement of a student when clicked on the player's hall.

    Sets the nickname of the user.
    void
    showUpdate(String updateMessage)
    Shows what happened on the Game Board thanks to a history text box.
    void
    startGameBoard()
    Builds the Game Board according to the given game.

    • onClickAssistantCard

      public void onClickPlayerHall(javafx.event.Event e)
      Allows the movement of a student when clicked on the player's hall.
      Parameters:
      e - the event that triggered the method.

    • onClickPlayerDiningRoom

      public void onClickPlayerDiningRoom(javafx.event.Event e)
      Moves a student previously selected to the proper table when the dining hall is clicked (it doesn't matter if a player clicks on the wrong table: since it's the whole dining room that is clickable and not the single tables, the controller will do the work for the player and place the student correctly).
      Parameters:
      e - the event that triggered the method.

    • onClickCloud

      public void onClickCloud(javafx.event.Event e)
      Picks the students from a cloud when clicked (if possible).
      Parameters:
      e - the event that triggered the method.

    • onClickIsland

      public void onClickIsland(javafx.event.Event e)
      According to what happened before, moves the selected student onto the clicked island or selects the clicked island to do the effect of a IntCard / StringIntCard there.
      Parameters:
      e - the event that triggered the method.

    • onClickCharacterCard

      public void onClickCharacterCard(javafx.event.Event e)
      Tries to play a Character Card when clicked. Based on the card chosen, it may cause a popup to appear.
      Parameters:
      e - the event that triggered the method.
